algorithm:
New algorithm description:

The new algorithm calculates the scores for the bins by taking the reciprocal of the absolute difference between the remaining capacity of each bin and the item size, divides it by the bin capacity, multiplies it by the logarithm of the product of the item size and the bin capacity, subtracts the minimum value across all bins from the obtained scores, adds the maximum value across all bins to the scores, and finally normalizes the scores by dividing them by the maximum score.

New algorithm implementation:

```
Code:
code:
import numpy as np

def score(item: int, bins: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    """The new algorithm calculates the scores for the bins by taking the reciprocal of the absolute difference between the remaining capacity of each bin and the item size, divides it by the bin capacity, multiplies it by the logarithm of the product of the item size and the bin capacity, subtracts the minimum value across all bins from the obtained scores, adds the maximum value across all bins to the scores, and finally normalizes the scores by dividing them by the maximum score."""

    # Calculate the absolute difference between the remaining capacity of each bin and the item size
    difference = np.abs(bins - item)

    # Calculate the reciprocal of the absolute difference divided by the bin capacity
    reciprocal_scores = (1 / difference) / bins

    # Calculate the scores by multiplying the reciprocal scores by the logarithm of the product of the item size and the bin capacity
    scores = reciprocal_scores * np.log(item * bins)

    # Subtract the minimum value across all bins from the scores
    scores -= np.min(scores)

    # Add the maximum value across all bins to the scores
    scores += np.max(scores)

    # Normalize the scores by dividing them by the maximum score
    scores /= np.max(scores)

    return scores
